meanings.definition: The addition of a sound or syllable at the beginning of a word.
meanings.sent1: In class, we learned about the prothesis of extra sounds in words.
meanings.sent2: The prothesis of 'un-' changes the meaning of the word.
meanings.sent3: The prothesis of 'super-' made the word supercalifragilisticexpialidocious!
meanings.sent4: Her prothesis of 're-' at the start of the word gave it a new twist.
meanings.sent5: The prothesis of 'anti-' made the word stand out in the sentence.

meanings.definition: A type of artificial limb or body part.
meanings.sent1: The athlete's prothesis helped him run again.
meanings.sent2: She got a new prothesis after the accident.
meanings.sent3: The robot's prothesis was shiny and advanced.
meanings.sent4: His prothesis allowed him to move with ease.
meanings.sent5: The prothesis was custom-made to fit perfectly.

meanings.definition: The addition of a letter or syllable at the beginning of a word to alter its meaning.
meanings.sent1: The prothesis of 'un-' changes the word to its opposite.
meanings.sent2: Adding a prothesis can completely change the word's sense.
meanings.sent3: The prothesis of 'mis-' made the word sound funny.
meanings.sent4: Her prothesis of 're-' gave the word a sense of repetition.
meanings.sent5: The prothesis of 'pre-' hinted at what was to come.
